item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Work is the curse of the drinking classes." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "Last night you said you wanted to know what to expect so you could better select your attire. I told you we were going to visit a vampire in a Goth-den tonight. Why, then, Ms. Lane, do you look like a perky rainbow?" -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
artichoke8 add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "I love books, by the way, way more than movies. Movies tell you what to think. A good book lets you choose a few thoughts for yourself. Movies show you the pink house. A good book tells you there's a pink house and lets you paint some of the finishing touches, maybe choose the roof style,park your own car out front. My imagination has always topped anything a movie could come up with. Case in point, those darned Harry Potter movies. That was so not what that part-Veela-chick, Fleur Delacour, looked like." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "The most confused we ever get is when we're trying to convince our heads of something our heart knows is a lie." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "You're leaving me, Rainbow Girl." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "Its our actions that define us. What we choose. What we resist. What we're willing to die for." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
artichoke8 add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description: "I was about to look away when he reached across the seat, touched my jaw with his long, strong, beautiful fingers, and caressed my face. Being touched by Jericho Barrons with kindness makes you feel like you must be the most special person in the world. It’s like walking up to the biggest, most savage lion in the jungle, lying down, placing your head it its mouth and, rather than taking your life, it licks you and purrs." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Karen Marie Moning
item.description:
"Time heals.
No, it doesn't. At best, time is the great leveler, sweeping us all into coffins. We find ways to distract ourselves from the pain. Time is neither scalpel nor bandage. It is indifferent. Scar tissue is not a good thing. It is merely the wound's other face." -- Karen Marie Moning

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "There's more to life than books, you know. But not much more." -- Morrissey

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "I still don't belong to anyone - I am mine." -- Morrissey

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "You're not right in the head, and nor am I, and this is why....this is why I like you." -- Morrissey

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "Oh, I can't help quoting you, because everything that you said rings true." -- Morrissey

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "People don't change who they are. They only change what they do with it." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "And then I did laugh, even though the future was a dangerous place, because I loved her, and she loved me, and the world was beautiful." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
artichoke8 add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "Mutual, respectful, enduring love is completely attainable as long as you swear you won't settle for less." -- Maggie Stiefvater

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "We cannot live only for ourselves. A thousand fibers connect us with our fellow men; and among those fibers, as sympathetic threads, our actions run as causes, and they come back to us as effects." -- Herman Melville

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Kim Harrison
item.description: "That's why I want you there, he said. You're unpredictable, and that can be the difference between success and failure. Most people make decisions in anger, fear, love, or obligation. You make decisions to irritate people." -- Kim Harrison

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Kim Harrison
item.description: "Oh for the sweet humpin' love of Tink! ~ Jenks" -- Kim Harrison

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Kim Harrison
item.description: "And then there are the rare ones who know love, who understand it. Who freely give of themselves, demanding only a return of that love,that trust." -- Kim Harrison

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "Fuck a zombie!" -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You're still trying to protect me. Real or not real," he whispers. "Real," I answer. "Because that's what you and I do, protect each other." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Cassandra Clare
artichoke8 add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "There is no pretending," Jace said with absolute clarity. "I love you, and I will love you until I die, and if there is life after that, I'll love you then." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: artichoke8 add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Is this the part where you start tearing off strips of your shirt to bind my wounds?" "If you wanted me to rip my clothes off, you should have just asked." -- Cassandra Clare
